title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 141-3.4 - Janitor
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 141-3.4 - Janitor

State Regulations
A
janitor
is a person employed to render
any physical service in connection with the maintenance, care or operation of a
residential building. Where there is only one employee, such employee shall be
deemed the janitor. Where there is more than one employee in the building, the
employer shall designate an employee who lives in the building as the janitor. No building may have more than one janitor. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
141-3.4

Amended

New

York State Register December 28, 2016/Volume XXXVIII, Issue 52, eff. 12/31/2016

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
